summary: Malay is a language spoken by around 290 million people, mainly in Southeast Asia, including Brunei, Indonesia, Malaysia, Singapore, and parts of Thailand and East Timor. It has different official names in each country, like Bahasa Malaysia or Bahasa Indonesia. The language has a long history, with a classical form used in ancient sultanates. There are many varieties of Malay, and some are so similar to the standard form that they might be considered dialects. It's also used as a trade language and has influenced other creole languages.
title: Malay language
